verbs.description: accinge (third-person singular simple present accinges, present participle accinging, simple past and past participle accinged)

entries.meaning: (reflexive, archaic) To prepare oneself for action.
examples: "Friend Seithenyn," said the abbot, when, having passed the castle gates, and solicited an audience, he was proceeding to the presence of Melvas, "this task, to which I have accinged myself is arduous, and in some degree awful;
